TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed PathFigure extends System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable implements class System.IFormattable

Docs.summary: Represents a subsection of a geometry, a single connected series of two-dimensional geometric segments.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A is made up of one or more figures, represented by the PathFigure class. Each figure is itself made up of one or more segments, defined by the class. ## XAML Object Element Usage ``` -or-   oneOrMoreSegments ``` ## XAML Values `oneOrMoreSegments` One or more object elements for objects that derive from . Typically these are: , , , , , , .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.PathFigure Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable clone of this , making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
Docs.returns: A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property will be even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property was

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable clone of this object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
Docs.returns: A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property will be even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property was .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.PathFigure GetFlattenedPathFigure() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a object that is an polygonal approximation of this object.
Docs.returns: The polygonal approximation of this object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The flattening process is lossy with respect to animation and curve segment parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Windows.Media.PathFigure GetFlattenedPathFigure (double tolerance, System.Windows.Media.ToleranceType type);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.PathFigure GetFlattenedPathFigure(float64 tolerance, valuetype System.Windows.Media.ToleranceType type) cil managed

Docs.param: Specifies how the error of tolerance is interpreted.
Docs.summary: Gets a object, within the specified error of tolerance, that is an polygonal approximation of this object.
Docs.returns: The polygonal approximation of this object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The flattening process is lossy with respect to animation and curve segment parameters.
`tolerance` determines how closely the curve is approximated.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether this figures first and last segments are connected.
Docs.value: if this figure's first and last segments are connected; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty IsClosedProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure.IsClosed%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets whether the contained area of this is to be used for hit-testing, rendering, and clipping.
Docs.value: Determines whether the contained area of this is to be used for hit-testing, rendering, and clipping. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property is set to `false`, then only the outline of the will be used, and its contained area will not contribute to the overall area of the . One use of this property is to allow unfilled strokes in an otherwise filled , like the mouth in the left Smiley below. Setting the mouth's IsFilled to `true` may produce the undesired effect of the mouth in the right Smiley. ![smiley path is filled](~/add/media/ref-mil-pathfigure-isfilled-smiley.PNG "smiley path is filled") IsFilled Example ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
